alert.note: Alert for Buchanan; Dickenson (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued February 02 at 8:05PM EST until February 04 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 7 AM EST THURSDAY THROUGH LATE THURSDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of northeast Kentucky, southwest Virginia and West Virginia, including the following counties, in northeast Kentucky, Boyd and Lawrence KY. In southwest Virginia, Buchanan and Dickenson. In West Virginia, Boone, Cabell, Jackson WV, Kanawha, Lincoln, Logan, Mason, McDowell, Mingo, Pleasants, Putnam, Ritchie, Roane, Tyler, Wayne, Wirt, Wood and Wyoming. * WHEN...From 7 AM EST Thursday through late Thursday night. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Low-water crossings may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Since soils are saturated and excessive rainfall is expected, possible flooding issues may arise during long moderate to heavy rainfall durations. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
